title: SpecDM: Hyperspectral Dataset Synthesis with Pixel-level Semantic Annotations
author: Wendi Liu (Wuhan University), Pei Yang (Wuhan University), Wenhui Hong (Wuhan University), Xiaoguang Mei (Wuhan University), Jiayi Ma (Wuhan University), ...
relevance_why: The generation of high-dimensional hyperspectral images with semantic annotations can provide methodologies applicable to audio and speech processing tasks, particularly in areas needing rich representations and data augmentation.
background: Generating labeled hyperspectral images that can be used for tasks like converting visual data into actionable insights, similar to audio data tasks requiring labeled datasets for training machine learning models.
contribution: This paper introduces SpecDM, a two-stream variational autoencoder-based method, to solve the challenge of costly hyperspectral data annotation, achieving high-quality hyperspectral images with corresponding pixel-level semantic labels.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing methods mainly focus on generating either images or annotations separately, often leading to a lack of annotation quality for high-dimensional datasets.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work innovatively combines image and mask generation in a joint framework using a diffusion model, leveraging latent space to effectively manage high-dimensional data.

key_innovation: Utilizes a two-stream variational autoencoder architecture that captures the joint distribution of hyperspectral images and their corresponding semantic annotations.
real_world_impact: Enables the easier generation of large-scale synthetic labeled datasets for hyperspectral remote sensing applications, potentially accelerating advancements in this domain by reducing data scarcity issues.
limitations: No specific limitations are mentioned in the paper.

new_terms.hyperspectral images: **Hyperspectral images** are images captured at many different wavelengths, providing detailed spectral information for each pixel, enabling finer analysis than traditional RGB images.
new_terms.two-stream variational autoencoder: **Two-stream variational autoencoder** is a deep learning architecture that learns to encode two distinct data streams simultaneously into a shared latent space, allowing for improved modeling of complex relationships between the data.
